revised_title: Model for the Retino-Tectal Projection and Axonal Growth
tldr: The article proposes a model for the retino-tectal projection, which assumes that axonal growth proceeds predominantly in the direction of the maximal slope of a guiding substance. The spatial distribution of this parameter results from the interaction of components of retinal axons and tectal components. The model can explain the generation of primary projections and some features of regulation, such as independence of projections on neural pathways and observations on the innervation of rotated pieces of tectum.
